job description:
The Dow Chemical Company has an exciting and challenging opportunity for a Research Scientist within Separation Technologies for Olefins, Aromatics and Alternatives R&D. This position will be located in Freeport, TX. The primary purpose of this role is to provide expertise for the conceptualization and development of new process separation technologies and designs. The work product of the Research Scientist will be key to the development, implementation, and commercialization of new processes. The successful candidate will lead multifunctional project teams and serve as a Subject Matter Expert in separation science including membranes and adsorbents for Olefins, Aromatics and Alternatives R&D. The candidate will be required to have the technical background to perform conceptual process design creatively incorporating emerging technologies associated with novel separations systems, and energy integration techniques. Additionally, the candidate will be responsible generating new project ideas and solutions and evaluating the potential of novel separation technologies.

Key responsibilities include:
  • Participation in multifunctional teams within Olefins and Aromatics to provide technical development and evaluation of separation technologies and improvements to existing plant designs.
  • Lead and consult on experimental designs for hypothesis development and validation for potential separation technologies to quickly identify critical issues in various technologies to direct research efforts..
  • Conceptualization of breakthrough technology for improvement in existing assets including providing risk/reward analysis of proposed solutions and new technology concepts.
  • Apply problem solving skills in an R&D environment.
  • Demonstrate competency in the use of experimental methods, data handling, and computational tools.
  • Develop an understanding of competitive technologies.
  • Demonstrate competency in laboratory, pilot plant, or in-plant data generation and process development.
  • Ability to plan, develop, evaluate, and implement technology using creative and scientifically sound methodology.
  • Documentation of results in reports and patent disclosures
Required Qualifications
  • Doctorate in Chemical Engineering (or Chemistry with appropriate industrial/process chemistry research)
  • Knowledge and experience in the areas of adsorbents and/or membranes for gas separation
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and must work effectively in multi-functional environment to understand, communicate, coordinate, and implement business objectives.
  • Demonstrated drive to document findings is required.
About DowDuPont

DowDuPont (NYSE: DWDP) is a holding company comprised of The Dow Chemical Company and DuPont with the intent to form strong, independent, publicly traded companies in agriculture, materials science and specialty products sectors that will lead their respective industries through productive, science-based innovation to meet the needs of customers and help solve global challenges. For more information, please visit us at www.dow-dupont.com.

The positions represented by this job posting are aligned to one of the three divisions, Agriculture, Materials Science or Specialty Products, which are expected to separate from DowDuPont into stand-alone public companies. Information on the division alignment will be provided during the recruitment process.
